title: montreal1
author: montreal1
content: Auction for an unopened Trezor hardware wallet that I purchased directly from Trezor in July 2015. I am posting it here because they seem to have changed the packaging, and it may now have value to some collectors. In the current packaging, I see "The Original Hardware Wallet" without the ",,A step in the evolution of bitcoin..." STARTING BID: .0000 BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT: .0001 BTCEND TIME: DECEMBER 5th, 2022, 12:00 NOON ESTPayment due in BTC within 24 hours of auction end. I will send the winner the payment addressSNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid.SHIPPING: $10 with tracking anywhere in the United States. $20 with tracking outside of the United States.Escrow allowed, winner pays fees.

comments.author: montreal1
comments.created_time: November 29, 2022, 02:08:16 AMLast edit: November 29, 2022, 03:17:56 AM by montreal1
comments.body: I found some additional information on the packaging update that took place in 2016.2016-The Trezor logo was changed from “TREZOR The Bitcoin Safe” to “TREZOR”.-“The Hardware Bitcoin Wallet” text was changed to “The original hardware wallet.”-The package grew in size to 100 x 100 x 13 mm.-Text on the package was made more scarce.-A sticker with a barcode and a UPC code was added at the back of the package.-The landing website in the instructions has been changed to trezor.io/start, instead of mytrezor.com.-All of the content is inside one boxSource: https://trezor.io/learn/a/authenticate-trezor-model-one

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Do you by any chance have the paperwork from your purchase and if so would you include it in the sale?When it comes to HW wallets I tend to be a little bit paranoid - even though I guess no one should really unpack and use this one (keep as a rare collectible instead).

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on December 01, 2022, 01:23:07 PMDo you by any chance have the paperwork from your purchase and if so would you include it in the sale?When it comes to HW wallets I tend to be a little bit paranoid - even though I guess no one should really unpack and use this one (keep as a rare collectible instead).I found the three emails associated with this purchase. I'd like to keep my email address private, but I'm sure I can forward these to the winner somehow if they'd like. The buytrezor links in the email are dead now and just redirect to https://trezor.io/ Unfortunately I don't have the box it came in or associated paperwork if there was any. I definitely see how device tampering is a concern with hw wallets, but like you said I don't know why someone would open it considering they are fairly cheap brand new direct from trezor. Trezor support may be able to review and authenticate the package/holographic seal if the winner decides to ever open it for some reason. Also, the trezor is white, not black. Apologies for the title saying it's black!

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: thank you for the bids so far! final bump - auction ends tomorrow

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Okay, thanks for the screenshots, montreal1Yea, I was shocked first when I saw them, thinking you doxxed yourself, but glad you did NOT post it with your e-mail. Oh and:0.0012

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on December 04, 2022, 05:39:34 PMOkay, thanks for the screenshots, montreal1Yea, I was shocked first when I saw them, thinking you doxxed yourself, but glad you did NOT post it with your e-mail. Oh and:0.0012Congrats Krypto! Pm sent
